author: bgw
message:
Turbopack: chore: Remove re-exports from turbopack crate (#85791)

I don't think these specific re-exports are too problematic, but we've moved away from the pattern of a few top-level crates re-exporting all of the rest of turbopack because in some cases it can make compilation performance much worse in the way that it structures the crate dependency graph.

Re-exports of "internal" crates can be useful in controlling what parts of the API is and isn't "public", but these re-exports aren't really doing that.

files.patch:
@@ -4282,9 +4282,11 @@ dependencies = [
  "turbopack-analyze",
  "turbopack-browser",
  "turbopack-core",
+ "turbopack-css",
  "turbopack-ecmascript",
  "turbopack-node",
  "turbopack-nodejs",
+ "turbopack-resolve",
  "turbopack-wasm",
  "urlencoding",
  "vergen",
@@ -4365,12 +4367,14 @@ dependencies = [
  "turbopack",
  "turbopack-browser",
  "turbopack-core",
+ "turbopack-css",
  "turbopack-ecmascript",
  "turbopack-ecmascript-plugins",
  "turbopack-ecmascript-runtime",
  "turbopack-image",
  "turbopack-node",
  "turbopack-nodejs",
+ "turbopack-resolve",
  "turbopack-static",
  "turbopack-trace-utils",
 ]
@@ -9544,7 +9548,9 @@ dependencies = [
  "turbopack-browser",
  "turbopack-cli-utils",
  "turbopack-core",
+ "turbopack-css",
  "turbopack-dev-server",
+ "turbopack-ecmascript",
  "turbopack-ecmascript-plugins",
  "turbopack-ecmascript-runtime",
  "turbopack-env",
@@ -9863,6 +9869,7 @@ dependencies = [
  "turbopack",
  "turbopack-cli-utils",
  "turbopack-core",
+ "turbopack-ecmascript",
  "turbopack-resolve",
  "turbopack-trace-utils",
 ]
@@ -10001,6 +10008,8 @@ dependencies = [
  "turbopack",
  "turbopack-browser",
  "turbopack-core",
+ "turbopack-css",
+ "turbopack-ecmascript",
  "turbopack-ecmascript-plugins",
  "turbopack-ecmascript-runtime",
  "turbopack-env",
@@ -10071,6 +10080,7 @@ dependencies = [
  "turbo-tasks-malloc",
  "turbopack",
  "turbopack-core",
+ "turbopack-ecmascript",
  "turbopack-resolve",
 ]
